verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that God did tempt Abraham, and said unto him, Abraham: and he said, Behold, here I am.
verses.ct: Some time later, God tested Abraham. He called out to him, "Abraham!" Abraham replied, "Here I am."

verses.kjv: And he said, Take now thy son, thine only son Isaac, whom thou lovest, and get thee into the land of Moriah; and offer him there for a burnt offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of.
verses.ct: God said, "Take your son, your only son Isaac, the one you love, and travel to the land of Moriah. There, sacrifice him as a burnt offering on a mountain that I will show you."

verses.kjv: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son, and clave the wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went unto the place of which God had told him.
verses.ct: Abraham got up early the next morning, prepared his donkey, and brought along two of his servants and his son Isaac. He chopped wood for the burnt offering, then set out for the place God had directed him to.

verses.kjv: Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off.
verses.ct: On the third day, Abraham looked up and spotted the place in the distance.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto his young men, Abide ye here with the ass; and I and the lad will go yonder and worship, and come again to you.
verses.ct: Abraham told his servants, "Stay here with the donkey. The boy and I will go over there to worship, and then we will return to you."

verses.kjv: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering, and laid it upon Isaac his son; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife; and they went both of them together.
verses.ct: Abraham placed the wood for the burnt offering on his son Isaac's back. He himself carried the fire and the knife, and the two of them walked on together.

verses.kjv: And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood: but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?
verses.ct: Isaac spoke up to his father Abraham, "Father?" Abraham answered, "Yes, my son?" Isaac asked, "I see the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?"

verses.kjv: And Abraham said, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering: so they went both of them together.
verses.ct: Abraham replied, "My son, God will provide himself a lamb for the burnt offering." The two of them continued walking together.

verses.kjv: And they came to the place which God had told him of; and Abraham built an altar there, and laid the wood in order, and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar upon the wood.
verses.ct: When they arrived at the place God had directed him to, Abraham constructed an altar and arranged the wood on it. Then he tied up his son Isaac and placed him on the altar, on top of the wood.

verses.kjv: And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his son.
verses.ct: Abraham reached out his hand and picked up the knife to kill his son.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD called unto him out of heaven, and said, Abraham, Abraham: and he said, Here am I.
verses.ct: But the angel of the LORD called out to him from heaven, "Abraham! Abraham!" He answered, "Here I am."

verses.kjv: And he said, Lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing thou hast not withheld thy son, thine only son from me.
verses.ct: The angel said, "Do not lay your hand on the boy, and do not do anything to harm him. Now I know that you fear God, because you have not held back your son, your only son, from me."

verses.kjv: And Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns: and Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son.
verses.ct: Abraham looked up and noticed a ram behind him, its horns tangled in a thicket. He went over, took the ram, and sacrificed it as a burnt offering in place of his son.

verses.kjv: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovahjireh: as it is said to this day, In the mount of the LORD it shall be seen.
verses.ct: Abraham named that place Jehovahjireh. To this day people say, "On the mount of the LORD it shall be seen."

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD called unto Abraham out of heaven the second time,
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD called out to Abraham from heaven a second time

verses.kjv: And said, By myself have I sworn, saith the LORD, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son:
verses.ct: and said, "I have sworn by myself, declares the LORD, that because you have done this and have not held back your son, your only son,

verses.kjv: That in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies;
verses.ct: I will surely bless you, and I will surely multiply your descendants like the stars of the heaven and like the sand on the seashore. Your descendants will take possession of the gates of their enemies.

verses.kjv: And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.
verses.ct: Through your descendants, all the nations of the earth will be blessed, because you have obeyed my voice."

verses.kjv: So Abraham returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba; and Abraham dwelt at Beersheba.
verses.ct: Then Abraham went back to his servants, and together they traveled to Beersheba. Abraham settled in Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, Behold, Milcah, she hath also born children unto thy brother Nahor;
verses.ct: After these events, Abraham received news: "Milcah has also given birth to children for your brother Nahor."

verses.kjv: Huz his firstborn, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,
verses.ct: They were Huz, the firstborn, his brother Buz, and Kemuel, who became the father of Aram,

verses.kjv: And Chesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Jidlaph, and Bethuel.
verses.ct: along with Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.

verses.kjv: And Bethuel begat Rebekah: these eight Milcah did bear to Nahor, Abrahamâ€™s brother.
verses.ct: Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. These eight sons Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham's brother.

verses.kjv: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash, and Maachah.
verses.ct: Nahor's concubine, whose name was Reumah, also gave birth to Tebah, Gaham, Thahash, and Maachah.
